publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1454 Alex Neil: Hepatitis C-That the Parliament notes with concern that there are currently 10,000 people carrying hepatitis C in Scotland and that there may be 50,000 undiagnosed cases; acknowledges that hepatitis C can be treated in a cost-effective manner through a comprehensive system of education, screening and holistic treatment, and recognises the work of C-Level, Capital C and other such groups in their attempts to gain adequate funding so that they might tackle the issue.
S1M-1454# Hepatitis C (lodged on 12 December 2000) Mr Kenneth Gibson*, Fergus Ewing*
S1M-1454# Hepatitis C (lodged on 12 December 2000) Fiona McLeod*

S1M-1454# Alex Neil: Hepatitis C-That the Parliament notes with concern that there are currently 10,000 people carrying hepatitis C in Scotland and that there may be 50,000 undiagnosed cases; acknowledges that hepatitis C can be treated in a cost-effective manner through a comprehensive system of education, screening and holistic treatment, and recognises the work of C-Level, Capital C and other such groups in their attempts to gain adequate funding so that they might tackle the issue. Supported by: Mr Kenneth Gibson, Fergus Ewing, Fiona McLeod
S1M-1454# Hepatitis C (lodged on 12 December 2000) Ms Margo MacDonald*, Tommy Sheridan*
S1M-1454# Hepatitis C (lodged on 12 December 2000) Shona Robison*, Christine Grahame*, Dorothy-Grace Elder*
S1M-1454# Hepatitis C (lodged on 12 December 2000) Mr Lloyd Quinan*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Michael Russell*, Nick Johnston*, Brian Adam*, Mr Gil Paterson*, Mary Scanlon*, Dr Winnie Ewing*

S1M-1454# Alex Neil: Hepatitis C—That the Parliament notes with concern that there are currently 10,000 people carrying hepatitis C in Scotland and that there may be 50,000 undiagnosed cases; acknowledges that hepatitis C can be treated in a cost-effective manner through a comprehensive system of education, screening and holistic treatment, and recognises the work of C-Level, Capital C and other such groups in their attempts to gain adequate funding so that they might tackle the issue. Supported by: Mr Kenneth Gibson, Fergus Ewing, Fiona McLeod, Ms Margo MacDonald, Tommy Sheridan, Shona Robison, Christine Grahame, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Mr Adam Ingram, Michael Russell, Nick Johnston, Brian Adam, Mr Gil Paterson, Mary Scanlon, Dr Winnie Ewing
S1M-1454# Hepatitis C (lodged on 12 December 2000) Andrew Wilson*, Mrs Margaret Ewing*, Michael Matheson*, Ms Sandra White*, Roseanna Cunningham*
S1M-1454# Hepatitis C (lodged on 12 December 2000) Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Tricia Marwick*, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton*

S1M-1454# Alex Neil: Hepatitis C—That the Parliament notes with concern that there are currently 10,000 people carrying hepatitis C in Scotland and that there may be 50,000 undiagnosed cases; acknowledges that hepatitis C can be treated in a cost-effective manner through a comprehensive system of education, screening and holistic treatment, and recognises the work of C-Level, Capital C and other such groups in their attempts to gain adequate funding so that they might tackle the issue. Supported by: Mr Kenneth Gibson, Fergus Ewing, Fiona McLeod, Ms Margo MacDonald, Tommy Sheridan, Shona Robison, Christine Grahame, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Mr Adam Ingram, Michael Russell, Nick Johnston, Brian Adam, Mr Gil Paterson, Mary Scanlon, Dr Winnie Ewing, Andrew Wilson, Mrs Margaret Ewing, Michael Matheson, Ms Sandra White, Roseanna Cunningham, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Tricia Marwick, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton
